page.title: 19HEREFORD CANAL SOCIETY
page.content: In April 1983 the Herefordshire and Gloucestershire Canal Society was formed to take an interest in the former canal. In the two years the Society has been in existence it has achieved some notable successes; both the Hereford City Council and the South Herefordshire District Council have passed resolutions supporting the protection of the line of the canal and a proposal to the same effect has been included in the Ledbury and District Plan. The Society is restoring a short length of the canal at Monkhide and has received financial support on two occasions from the Welsh Water Authority and a donation of Â£500 has recently been received from the Inland Waterways Association.
